com.procom.filefly

Class ReceiveActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.app.Activity
      • android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity
        • com.procom.filefly.ReceiveActivity

  • public class ReceiveActivity
extends android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity
    The FragmentActivity that will launch in response to an ACTION_VIEW intent from the Android Beam API, copy the transferred file into the received subdirectory of the FileFly directory found on the root of the SD Card.
    Since:
    2014-10-15
    Version:
    0.2a
    Author:
    Peter Piech, Saurabh Sharma, Jacob Abramson

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.lang.String mFirstName
      The parsed out sender's first name
      private Intent mIntent
      The incoming Intent with a android.content.Intent#ACTION_VIEW schema containing a android.net.Uri for the transferred file.
      private java.lang.String mLastName
      The parsed out sender's last name
      private java.lang.String mOriginalFileName
      The parsed out original filename that was selected by the user
      private java.lang.String mPath
      A File representing the path to the transferred file

      • handleFileUri

        private java.lang.String handleFileUri(Uri beamUri)
        To get the directory path, get the path part of the URI, which contains all of the URI except the file: prefix. Create a File from the path part, then get the parent path of the File:
        Parameters:
        beamUri - The android.net.Uri embedded in the incoming Intent
        Returns:
        The filename stored in the android.net.Uri

        Returns:
        The filename stored in the android.net.Uri
